alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:25PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Washington, south central Wayne and northern Greene Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 425 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of State Line, or 13 miles northwest of Leakesville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leakesville and Fruitdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
